home.intro: Empowering creators to build a more inclusive digital world, Accessible First (a11y 1st) is your comprehensive guide to web accessibility. Whether you're a developer, designer, or content creator, our platform offers expert insights, practical tutorials, and hands-on courses to make accessibility an integral part of your workflow.

accessibility-today.title: Accessibility Today: The Blog
accessibility-today.intro: Staying informed about accessibility isn't just about compliance—it's about creating a world where everyone can participate fully. From digital spaces to physical environments, understanding the latest accessibility developments helps us build a more inclusive society where no one is left behind.

accessibility.accessibilityInfo: refers to the design of products, devices, services, or environments to be usable by all people, to the greatest extent possible,
accessibility.accessibilityExtra: without the need for adaptation or specialized design.
accessibility.accessibilityExtraB: The goal of universal design is to ensure that individuals with a wide range of abilities and disabilities can access and use these things in a way that is similar to those without such limitations.

universal.universalInfo: is an approach to creating environments, products, and services that are inherently accessible to all people, regardless of their age, ability, or status in life
universal.universalExtra: without the need for adaptation or specialized design.
universal.universalExtraB: It goes beyond basic accessibility requirements to create solutions that work well for everyone from the start.
universal.universalDataTitle: The 7 key principles of universal design are:
universalData: Size and Space for Approach and Use

accessible-healhcare.accessible-healhcareInfo: is a comprehensive approach to medical services that ensures all individuals, regardless of their physical abilities, economic status, cultural background, or geographic location,
accessible-healhcare.accessible-healhcareExtra: can effectively obtain, use, and benefit from health services and information.
accessible-healhcare.accessible-healhcareExtraB: It encompasses physical access to facilities, affordability of care, timely service delivery, and clear communication, all designed to provide appropriate and equitable healthcare for everyone in the community.

disability-rights.disability-rightsInfo: are legal and social protections ensuring that individuals with disabilities have equal opportunities, access, and treatment in all aspects of society. These rights aim to guarantee,
disability-rights.disability-rightsExtra: full participation in economic, social, political, and cultural life freedoms as complete and equal members of society.
disability-rights.disability-rightsExtraB: This encompasses protection against discrimination and ensures access to education, healthcare, transportation, and technology, and recognizes disability as a form of human diversity.

inclusivity.inclusivityInfo: when related to accessibility, is the deliberate practice of designing environments, systems, and experiences that welcome and accommodate all individuals,
inclusivity.inclusivityExtra: regardless of their physical, cognitive, sensory, or economic abilities.
inclusivity.inclusivityExtraB: It ensures that every person can fully participate, understand, and engage without barriers, by creating adaptable spaces, communication methods, and services that recognize and respect diverse human capabilities.

phisical-accessibility.phisical-accessibilityInfo: is the design and implementation of spaces, environments, and infrastructure that can be independently and safely navigated and used by all individuals,
phisical-accessibility.phisical-accessibilityExtra: regardless of their physical abilities, mobility limitations, or assistive device requirements.
phisical-accessibility.phisical-accessibilityExtraB: It involves removing physical barriers and creating environments with features like ramps, wide doorways, level entrances, appropriate signage, adaptable equipment, and thoughtful spatial arrangements without assistance or unnecessary obstacles.
